title.narrative: OUTPUT 2.1: EDUCATION ENABLING ENVIRONMENT

description.narrative: By 2024, the education sector uses solid evidence to influence policies, plans and budgets to reduce the number of out-of-school children and overage enrolment at early childhood and basic education for girls and boys, including adolescents., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Access To Quality Learning Opportunities (Covid), Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2024 more school-aged girls and boys, especially the disadvantaged, have equitable access to quality inclusive early childhood and basic education.

mailing-address.narrative: Sekou Toure Avenue Mamba Point Monrovia

sector.narrative: System strengthening - Education management information system (does not include learning assessment system)
System strengthening - Education sector coordination, SDG 4, etc.
System strengthening - Evidence based education sector planning
Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

related-activity.ref: 2550/A0/09/882 OUTCOME 2:. EARLY LEARNING AND BASIC EDUCATION

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2024, the education sector uses solid evidence to influence policies, plans and budgets to reduce the number of out-of-schoolchildren and overage enrolment at early childhood and basic education for girls and boys, including adolescents.

description.narrative: National systems were established to enhance performance and generate evidence to improve age-appropriate enrolment and data on early childhood development (ECD) and basic education. The partnership base was expanded for better engagement with adolescents. Interministerial support improved and county-level monitoring was activated to strengthen the decentralized approach to programming and ensure consistent tracking of participation in learning. Host communities were empowered to engage in school management and establish baseline data on 245 schools identified as multiservice platforms for evidence generation and scale-up of innovations. Discussions for ongoing collaboration on education budgeting was begun with 16 Parliamentarians. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:25/01/2022
